pros: Benefits are really good, including gradually increasing PTO,health,401k match,remote working abilities and schedule flexibility.
cons:
Senior positions continue to be filled by outside hires,
No up-or-out for middle management, and Apathetic long time employees riding out the latest changes until new management changes direction,
New work flow includes more committees than the US Congress.
advice_to_mgmt:
Identify talented workers within our company committed to our mutual success for promotion and allow them to interview for higher roles.

No need to flush the culture of the company, just because of the previous ELT. It's legacy has given it a strong market position.

Don't reduce staff unless you've made the role redundant with technology.

review_title: Great company to work for, rotten job to do.
pros: AIG treats their employees like gold. Excellent compensation, great benefits/health insurance, unheard of PTO.
cons: Everything else. I am an Account Executive (I sell their life insurance products). At the end of the day, what I am selling is quite literally nothing but pure profit to a greedy fat insurance company. They do not care about their customers whatsoever. We are trained to bull the customer over on calls just to make the $ale. AIG has notoriously poor customer service (they outsource to the Philippines, hah) and it is difficult to sell their products with integrity knowing the headache clients will face if they have to file a death benefit claim.

pros: Work from home, company car
cons: The company stability is very good with numerous layoffs

pros: great people- overall good work/life balance
cons: Undergoing changes - tough environment to navigate

pros: I enjoyed the people and the work. Benefits are great!
cons: Some of the elevators were wonky.

review_title: Was a good company when I joined, not anymore
pros: Fair pay, good benefits. Most of the people were competent.
cons: Constant exec-level turnovers averaging ~ once a year. Little to no IT leadership. Dysfunctional processes. Entrenched mid-level management. Constantly changing corp directives and half-baked, failed initiatives. Excessive focus on "diversity" rather than competency and skill. Emphasis on cost-cutting vs revenue growth. More recently, massive layoffs across IT areas. Those "left behind" are now even more overtasked.
advice_to_mgmt: Same as many other reviewers have already said but no changes have happened, so apparently management doesn't read or act on these comments.

pros: Loved the job got to learn the insurance industry
cons: Due to frequent lay offs the morale of the employees are low

review_title: Love the work, but ‘doing more with less’ year after year has begun to shift my loyalty away from AIG.
pros: Super benefits, 401K with company match, health, life, ample amount of paid time off for employees with 5+ years, work remotely 1/2 the week, and I know I add value to the org every day.
cons: There is a lot of talk about work life balance here, and there has been for years, but they are just buzzwords here. Employees are consistently asked to more with less people and in less time. Unrealistic expectations around delivery dates come from top leadership and flow down to middle management, and then out to each employee. Eventually, there is no one left to delegate the work to, so those employees miss dinner with the fam, their son’s baseball games, or every doctor appointment they know they need to schedule, but who has the time for that? Not the guy on his laptop that is working during the baseball game instead of enjoying it.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop the unrealistic expectations with you. Tell your boss no once in a while. Tell the guy your entire team of 15 has no bandwidth for those 4 new projects. Do that, and you’ve saved your employees 5 more projects you don’t have to delegate and they don’t have to miss dinner for.

pros:
I worked with one of the best group of colleagues and AIG. The culture is friendly and conducive for productive work. You enjoy working here.
Company pays well and had some great benefits. Performance bonuses are based on the team/ project that you’re connected with and not for individual efforts. So if you’re lucky to get great project then you’re recognized with great bonus.
Good CSR volunteering opportunities.
cons: Constant changes in the management. Continuously firing of teams and scrapping of projects lead to low morals and stressful environment. Lack of stability and no raise for years. No career advancement.
advice_to_mgmt: Retain good talent. The company really have great people with valuable knowledge and experience. Think twice before cutting down the veterans and hiring new people.
